comment: The information from the course was very helpful, the teacher was not. Nice man, however he reads directly from lecture slides with no additional commentary and I found it taxing to arrive to class just to hear something I could've read. Additionally, his instruction can be confusing. He also emphasizes the concept of citing work, which is helpful.

If you like showing up to class to just listen to PowerPoint reading this class might be for you! The course work is literally just some assignments, discussion posts, and a final large group project (That's a competition?). Also he grades assignments super strictly, you didn't put like 1 link? here's your -40 points.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Do not take in person like all of the other students have said, this guy has terrible lectures consisting of directly reading from the powerpoint. Combined with the majority of class being almost unwatchable videos about HCI. Read the directions of your assignments carefully, he includes directions like "Do this or you get a zero" buried in paragra
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Do not take this professor. The instructions are unclear, and if not all read, he will give you a bad grade as he is very particular about what is submited. And assignments are just Wikipedia 90%. 

The final was never communicated to be a competition and was only revealed two weeks after it was due. So, the rubric didn't even matter.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects

comment:
KSU owes me gas money for all the times I drove to class just for the professor to show us 4 Healthcare./gov YouTube videos narrated by TTS, or read an entire PowerPoint out loud with no additional comments.
Course content is easy, but somehow this was the most confusing class I've ever taken in my life. Unpredictable grading. Take any other prof.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: The professor harshly grades students on very minor or small mistakes. Then the professors leaves no feedback or leaves vague feedback. Avoid if you can!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--So many papers

comment: This class is an easy A but the lectures won't be very useful. You will have to learn on your own. He grades well but be careful with the exams.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Beware! Don't take this class if you actually care to learn. All tests and quizzes are taken directly from the PowerPoint presentations and there was always a quiz question or two that I missed because the course material is so outdated. Even worse, there is zero feedback from the professor on anything, so good luck knowing where points got lost.

Horrible excuse for a professor and It is such a detriment to students. It seems he does everything he can to shirk responsibility and accountability for teaching this course. He does not give any relevant or helpful feedback and only gives vague unspecific answers to questions. Does not seem to care about course he's teaching or the students
rating_tags: Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Currently taking him now in the Fall 2020. Every single one of these negative remarks is true. I am taking him for an online class, and all we got were PP's and assignments. Which was cool but when you email him questions he said "read" midterm and final were open ended questions. If i died today I would rest easy know I dont have to take this clas
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: DON'T SIGN UP FOR ONE OF HIS COURSES! One of the worst in the CCSE department.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Wouldn't recommend. He's nice but uncommunicative; responds to emails days later. Weekly quizzes, 6 assignments, short-answer midterm, M/C final. Provides extensions. Assignments require outside research for a perfect score; short, straightforward answers from the textbook aren't enough. Textbook/PPTs are VERY dry, and midterm and final are tough.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Please AVOID taking his classes. His mid term and final are short answers and how he grades sucks. Taking the online class we had a quiz what seemed like every week. He has worked in the tech industry for less than 5 years and that was in 1990's ��. I got no value from him or the class. His class really made me consider DROPPING OUT.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Wow wow! I see the rating but actually this guy is not as bad as portrayed. Considering the amount of material we had to cover in the web class? At least the slides ensured that we stayed on track and covered most of it. I suggest be ready to read (esp. your slides). Talk to him, ask questions, he gives good feedback & lets you resubmit lab work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: The worst professor at KSU. I was really wanting to learn something from this class but the professor doesnt even know the material himself to teach it. He just reads off the department made powerpoints. There is 8 online quizzes and then a 27 short answer midterm and final. None of which he teaches you so good luck finding the information. Avoid.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I vow to never take this professor again. I am picking my classes for next semester based on what classes he is not teaching. Midterm and Final are 27 short answer questions in which none of the material he teaches you. He doesnt know any of the material himself because he reads off the slides that the department head gave him for his course
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Don't take him if you want to learn something. I've been working on Linux systems and FOSS software for the past three years and the material he used is outdated (can't say it's his cause he showed old YT videos). The assignments are also worse than busywork. Sadly, it's classes (and professors) like this that really drive people away from Linux.
rating_tags: Group projects--Tough grader

comment: This professor is by far one of the worst professor at Kennesaw State. The measure in which he grades the lab assignments are unreasonable , considering that this is an intro class ,and he does little to nothing to teach. He get's easily irritated, which I believe is because he does not know the subject that he is teaching and gets flustered.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Lectures are read straight from ppt with videos which are usually much more informative than his actual lectures. Lab assignments vague at times, but does give you the chance to fix them after initial grading for some points back. Tests are 25 short answer questions and very difficult to do well on. Last test the highest grade was an 80. No curve.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: DON'T TAKE HIM!!!! All he does is read from the slides and play youtube videos. He doesn't do any further explanation and is easily frustrated. He sees his class fail his tests miserably, but doesn't care. This is basically an online class in person. Save your time and your gpa and take someone else. I'M BEGGING YOU. 2 tests, 1 final
Worst Professor in the History of KSU
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Literally reads from power slides from another professor, doesn't even bother to paraphrase and ends the class with you tube videos. Professor lectures like a robot disguised as a human being, but grades like an eight year old picking grades out of a hat with a blindfold on.

Professor Windland essentially just reads off of power points made by another professor and Youtube videos that last 40 minutes of class. Do not take this professor if you want to get an A in the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Windland is your run of the mill, uninspired, powerpoint reading instructor that you unfortunately run into very often these days. His assignments are easy at first, but as you go on you will find little to no guidance on how to complete what he asks of you from the powerpoints or his in class instruction (which is reading powerpoints.)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I'm not going to say "don't take Windland AT ALL" but I do want to throw caution to those who may consider taking an online course with him (especially this one); you'll receive reading assignments and the powerpoints that come with the textbooks. That's about it. Great if that's your learning style. Wasn't really mine, obviously.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The class as a whole was not that bad. It was mostly for you to understand the major concepts, so get ready to read. Easy, as long as you understand, labs and very enjoyable class. Did not make a high grade but still happy with the time with the professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: My time with Professor Windland was one of the worst classes of my experience in college so far. Lectures consist of him reading the slides word for word, with occasional youtube videos following. If you want a narrator, take him. Otherwise, you're better off taking the class online, because he doesn't do any more teaching than your computer can.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Class consisted of weekly quizzes, usually first class meet of the week. No exam except for final. There is also a group project. Extra credit at the end of semester to improve your grade. Lectures are given straight out of the book. Study the quizzes, assignments, and read the book and you'll do fine. But you have to put in the work. Recommended.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Windland's OS Systems class consists of lectures from the book and quizzes weekly. Don't expect to go much beyond the author's words in class. The class consisted of these weekly quizzes, occasional assignments, a group project, and the final. Make sure you're good with reading if you want to do well in it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He just has a stern exterior but is actually very sweet and can be helpful. I forgot about a quiz and he was nice enough to let me take it. Doesn't like tardiness.   Lectures are done directly from the book and quizzes were every week, but were also by the book. Offers extra credit via a presentation on a topic of your choosing.
